alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:52AM EST until December 19 at 12:06PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...New York... Towanda Creek At Monroeton affecting Bradford County. Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. West Branch Delaware At Walton affecting Delaware County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Oneida Creek At Oneida affecting Oneida and Madison Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tunkhannock Creek at Tunkhannock. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. In the past several families in the Lazy Brook Park were evacuated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:28 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 13.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
